intro: Actephila bella, commonly known as the pretty leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Actephila bella is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
